ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Angle_taper is a constant change in shape of a feature for a part. The start of the Angle_taper is at the placement of a feature and is applied to the entire feature. The length of the taper is determined from the feature that is applying the Angle_taper.
Figure 1 illustrates features that have an Angle_taper applied.
Angle_taper

specifies the amount of slope from the start of an Angle_taper to the end of the Angle_taper. An angle between 0 and 90 degrees or between -90 and -180 degrees indicates that the profile for a feature grows larger along the feature path. An angle between 0 and -90 degrees or between 90 and 180 degrees indicates that the profile for a feature grows smaller along the feature path.

A Bevel_gear is a type of
that is used in meshing pairs where the axes of the pairs intersect. Each Bevel_gear is either a , or a . The Bevel_gear definition is based upon the shaft angle which is defined as the smallest angle through which one of the axes must be rotated to be parallel. This angle is a critical part of bevel gear design. For a gear design, the shaft angle is required for defining the pitch angle from which the tip_angle and root_angle are defined.
Figure 2 illustrates the Bevel_gear, and Figure 3 illustrates the shaft angle, and pitch angle.
Bevel_gear
Bevel_gear with shaft angle, and pitch angle
specifies the angle between the axis and the root of the teeth.

ext_description.p: specifies the angle between the axis and the tip of the teeth.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Blind_bottom_condition is a selection type of
that has material in the bottom of a hole and does not go through the entire part. Each Blind_bottom_condition is either a , a , a , a , or a .
specifies a boolean value of TRUE if the Blind_bottom_condition is positioned at the end of a , and a value of FALSE if it is at the start of the .

A Boss is a type of
that is a closed shape that protrudes from the surface of the part. The intersection of the Boss and the base surface may have a radius shaped blend between them. Each Boss is either a , a , or a . The Boss may be positioned on the face of a part with the Z-axis in the direction away from the part, or at the top of the Boss with the Z-axis in the direction toward the part face.

specifies the maximum height of a Boss measured from the highest point on the Boss to the farthest point of intersection between the Boss and the part surface. The placement and orientation of the
shall be the same as the Boss feature.
specifies a radius shape blend between a Boss and the surrounding surface at the base of the Boss. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the shape of the top of a Boss feature.

A Boss_top_condition is the end shape of a
that is the farthest distance away from the intersection of the face of the part and the . A
top may be either flat or of any other shape. Each Boss_top_condition is either a
or a .

ext_description.p:
specifies a radius shape blend between a Boss_top_condition and the surrounding
surface at the top of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note:
If the Boss_top_condition is a
that defines a spherical shape, the top_radius does not necessarily apply.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a boolean value of TRUE if the Boss_top_condition is located at the start of the , FALSE if it is located at the end of the .

A Catalogue_gear is a type of
that is a reference to a document containing the information to create a gear on a part.
Figure 5 illustrates a Catalogue_gear that is a 24 toothed gear with further definition found in a specification.
Catalogue_gear

specifies the document that defines information pertaining to a
feature.

A Catalogue_knurl is a type of
that is a reference to a document containing the information to create a knurl on a part.
Figure 6 illustrates a Catalogue_knurl that is a diagonal knurl with further definition found in a specification called ANSI B94.6.
Catalogue_knurl

specifies the document that defines information pertaining to a
feature.

A Catalogue_marking is a type of
that is a reference to a document containing the information for marking on a surface of a part.
Figure 7 illustrates a Catalogue_marking with a
value of '1928-12345ED34' a documentation value of 'ANSI/SAEAS478-2 ', and associated data for the .
Catalogue_marking

specifies the document or specification that defines information pertaining to a
feature.

A Catalogue_thread is a type of
that is a reference to a document containing the information to create threads on a part.
Figure 8 illustrates a Catalogue_thread that is an outer thread with values for the documentation associated data.
Catalogue_thread

specifies the document that defines information pertaining to a
feature.

specifies the dimension of the largest diameter of the
and is applied to both an internal and an external thread. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Chamfer is a type of
that is a transition between corresponding edges of two joining non-coplanar surfaces, having a flat cross section. A Chamfer feature requires an offset length from one face, and either an angular amount from the same surface or an offset length from a second face.
Figure 9 illustrates a Chamfer applied to a rectangular block and the chamfer_face associated data. The offset amount and angle amount attribtes apply to the , , , and
entities.
Chamfer
specifies the flat transition face between the two edges of two faces.
specifies a face and offset amount for one of the edges of the Chamfer.
specifies a face and either an offset amount or angle amount for one of the edges of the Chamfer.

A Chamfer_angle is a type of
that is the measured angle from the
face to the
face for creating a
feature.
Figure 9 illustrates a , a Chamfer_angle, and the angle_amount associated data.

specifies the angular measurement from a face for creating a
feature.

A Circular_boss is a type of
that is a cylindrical shape. A Circular_boss may be tapered.
Figure 10 illustrates a Circular_boss with a planar top and a fillet radius, and Figure 11 illustrates a Circular_boss with taper.
Circular_boss
Circular_boss with taper

specifies the diameter required by a Circular_boss. The diameter is the distance across the Circular_boss. The placement of the circular_profile shall be with the origin of the
at the origin of the Circular_boss. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the Circular_boss.
specifies a taper that defines the change in shape of the Circular_boss. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Circular_closed_profile is a type of
that is an enclosed area bounded by a circle. The orientation is at the center of the circle.
Figure 12 illustrates a Circular_closed_profile.
Circular_closed_profile
specifies the distance across the Circular_closed_profile.

A Circular_closed_shape_profile is a type of
that defines a completely enclosed volume.

specifies the outline of the
feature. The outline defines an area that shall be enclosed and circular. The placement of the
shall be with the origin of the , that defines the profile, at the origin of the Circular_closed_shape_profile. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the Circular_closed_shape_profile.

A Circular_cutout is a type of
that is an enclosed volume of circular shape. A Circular_cutout is similar in definition to a , but differ in the type of process required to manufacture.

specifies the distance across the Circular_cutout. The placement and orientation of the
shall be the same as the Circular_cutout feature.

A Circular_offset_pattern is a
with a modification of the placement of a particular occurrence of the base feature relative to its expected placement.
Figure 13 illustrates a Circular_offset_pattern. The rectangular base shape is offset from index number seven.
Circular_offset_pattern
specifies the value for unique identification of a location of a base feature used in a .
specifies the amount of offset from the expected feature location in a , along the base feature diameter for placing another feature.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Circular_offset_pattern is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Circular_offset_pattern as its . There shall exist one or more Circular_patterns for the Circular_offset_pattern.

A Circular_omit_pattern is a
with an omission of a particular occurrence of the base feature.
Figure 14 illustrates a Circular_omit_pattern with the omission of the rectangular base shape from index number 7.
Circular_omit_pattern
specifies the value for unique identification of the base feature to be omitted in a .

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Circular_omit_pattern is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Circular_omit_pattern as its . There shall exist one or more Circular_patterns for the Circular_omit_pattern.

A Circular_path_feature_component is a type of
that is a direction of travel along an arc of constant radius around the Z-axis of the feature. Each Circular_path_feature_component is either a
or a .
specifies the constant distance from an axis for the Circular_path_feature_component.

A Circular_pattern is a type of
that is a base feature arranged in a pattern around a circular arc, equally spaced about an axis. Instances of base features need not be rotated. When a base feature rotation is required, the first feature instance is not rotated. The second through the Nth feature instance are rotated by the same angular amount measured from the placement and orientation of the preceding feature instance. (This does not imply the use of chain dimensioning.)
Figure 15 illustrates a Circular_pattern with rotation of a base feature, and Figure 16 illustrates a Circular_pattern without rotation.
Circular_pattern with rotation
Circular_pattern without rotation
specifies the definition to offset any number of base features from the . The relocated_base_feature need not be specified for a particular . There may be more than one relocated_base_feature for a .
specifies the definition to remove any number of base features from the . The missing_base_feature need not be specified for a particular . There may be more than one missing_base_feature for a .
specifies the angle to rotate one feature in regard to the orientation of a previous feature in a .
specifies the quantity of a base feature to be used in a .
specifies the size of the circle for placement of features in a . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the angle amount between features in a .

A Closed_profile is a type of
that is an outline or shape that bounds an enclosed area with no opening. Each Closed_profile is either a , a , an , or a .

A Closed_slot is a type of
that has a course of travel defined by a
that is closed and has no opening.
specifies the type of closed shape at the ends of the .
specifies a 3D space curve, that when combine with a , creates the shape of the .

A Complete_circular_path_feature_component is a type of
that is a direction of travel that begins and ends at the same point on the arc.
Figure 17 illustrates a
feature with a
and a Complete_circular_path_feature_component.
Complete_circular_path_feature_component

A Compound_feature is a type of
that is a union of one or more
objects to create a more complex feature definition. The placement of a Compound_feature is relative to either the part, another Compound_feature, or a
which uses a Compound_feature as the base feature. Features which are elements of the Compound_feature have placement defined relative to the Compound_feature placement.
Figure 18 illustrates an example of a Compound_feature with one
feature and one
feature.
Compound_feature
specifies the base features that when combined defines a Compound_feature. There shall be more than one element for a Compound_feature.

A Compound_feature_element is a specification of the type of
or
to be used for a particular element of a . A
consists of two or more Compound_feature_element objects and need not require Compound_feature_element objects to be ordered.
specifies the base feature to be used as one of the components for the .

A Compound_feature_relationship is a definition of the sequence in which the
elements are applied in the . The Compound_feature_relationship defines which feature is the preceding feature and which is the succeeding feature.

specifies the
with the highest precedence.

specifies
with a lesser precedence.

A Conical_hole_bottom is a type of
that defines the bottom of a
to be conical in shape. A Conical_hole_bottom shall be a constant decrease in the hole diameter until the radius is zero. The Conical_hole_bottom may have a tip_radius defined at the smallest end of the Conical_hole_bottom.
Figure 19 illustrates the Conical_hole_bottom for a .
Conical_hole_bottom

specifies the amount of constant slope to decrease the
diameter until the diameter is zero. The tip_angle is a conical bottom for a . The tip_angle shall be greater than 0 degrees and less than 180 degrees.

specifies the radius of a conical bottom for a . A conical bottom is a constant decrease in diameter until the diameter is zero, or until it becomes tangent to a tip_radius. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Constant_radius_edge_round is a type of
that is defined with a constant radius value.
Figure 20 illustrates the Constant_radius_edge_round on a rectangular block.
Constant_radius_edge_round

specifies the amount of offset from the
to the center of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the amount of offset from the
to the center of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the amount of curvature for a convex transition between the two faces of a Constant_radius_edge_round.

A Constant_radius_fillet is a type of
that is defined with a constant radius value.
Figure 21 illustrates the Constant_radius_fillet. The
surface is not necessarily tangent to the other surfaces because the offsets.
Constant_radius_fillet

specifies the amount of offset from the
to the center of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the amount of offset from the
to the center of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the amount of curvature for a concave transition between two surfaces.

A Counterbore_hole is a type of
that is a combination of two Round_holes. The first
shall have either a
or , the second shall have a , and a larger diameter than the first . The top of the first
shall mate with the bottom of the second . The Counterbore_hole orientation shall be the same as the orientation of the first . Both Round_holes shall be co-axial.
Figure 22 illustrates the Counterbore_hole with a
and a .
Counterbore_hole

specifies the
that will be used as the smaller hole for the Counterbore_hole.

specifies the
that will be used as the larger hole for the Counterbore_hole.

A Countersunk_hole is a type of
that is a combination of two Round_holes. The first
shall have a
or . The second shall be a
with a , and a taper. The top of the first
shall mate with the bottom of the second . The taper of the second
shall be larger than the diameter of the , decreasing to the same diameter at the point where the two holes join. The Countersunk_hole orientation shall be the same as the orientation of the first . Both Round_holes shall be co-axial.
Figure 23 illustrates the Countersunk_hole with a
and a .
Countersunk_hole

specifies the
without a taper that will be used as the constant diameter hole for the Countersunk_hole.

specifies the
with a taper that will be used as the tapered hole for the Countersunk_hole.

A Cutout_feature is a type of
that is a volume to be removed from the part. Cutouts shall pass through two faces of a part. Each Cutout_feature is either a
or a .
Figure 24 illustrates the Cutout_feature.
Cutout_feature
specifies the shape of the bottom of a Cutout_feature feature. The bottom_condition shall pass entirely through the part, it shall be a .

A Defined_gear is a type of
that is specified explicitly, all attributes for a
are declared and defined. Each Defined_gear is either a , a
or a .

A Defined_marking is a type of
that is specified explicitly, all attributes for a
are declared and defined.
Figure 25 illustrates the Defined_marking on a rectangular block shape and with text of 'TEXT FOR A MARKING'.
Defined_marking

ext_description.p: specifies the appearance of the characters. A font consists of type face, treatment, and size. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: Examples of font_name characteristic are type face Times Roman a treatment of Bold or Italic size 10 point.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a description on how to apply the text given by the Defined_marking entity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the amount of space between text letters used for a Defined_marking feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the size of the text used for a Defined_marking feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Defined_thread is a type of
that is specified explicitly.
Figure 26 illustrates a Defined_thread. The drawing note '1.500-6 UNC-2A' applies to the thread and is separated into several of the Defined_thread attributes.
Defined_thread

specifies the distance between the opposing points of the thread. The crest is formed by the intersection of the sides of the thread if extended, if necessary, beyond the top of the thread. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the dimension of the smallest diameter of the Defined_thread and is applied to both an internal and an external thread. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the dimension of an imaginary cylinder passing through the threads so as to make equal the widths of the threads and the widths of the spaces cut by the cylinder. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the dimension of the largest diameter of the
and is applied to both an internal and an external thread.

A Diagonal_knurl is a type of
with helical cuts at an angle about the axis of a surface.
Figure 27 illustrates a Diagonal_knurl with a right hand helix.
Diagonal_knurl
specifies a description of whether the helix angle is applied to an orientation axis in a clockwise or a counterclockwise direction.
specifies the angle the knurl pattern makes with the orientation axis of an applied to surface.

A Diameter_taper is a constant change in shape of a feature for a part. A Diameter_taper starts at the placement of a feature and is applied to the entire feature. The initial diameter and the length of the taper is determined from the
that is applying the Diameter_taper. The final_diameter is specified as a diameter different than the initial diameter.
Figure 28 illustrates the Diameter_taper.
Diameter_taper

ext_description.p: specifies the diameter of the circle at the end of the taper. The final_diameter may be smaller or larger than the beginning diameter for a .
ext_description.note: The diameter at the beginning of the Diameter_taper is the same as the referencing feature diameter.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Diamond_knurl is a type of
that is a knurl ridge that is doubly helical, a left hand and a right hand helix, about the axis of a surface, with equal spacing of the two.
Figure 29 illustrates a Diamond_knurl.
Diamond_knurl
specifies the angle the knurl pattern makes with the orientation axis of an applied to surface.

A Directed_taper is a constant change in shape of a feature for a part. A Directed_taper starts at the location of the placement of a feature and is applied to the entire feature. The length of the taper is determined from the
that is applying the Directed_taper.
specifies the reference direction from which the Directed_taper angle is measured. The direction specifies a vector that points in the direction to apply the taper.

specifies the amount of slope from the start of the Directed_taper to the end of the Directed_taper. An angle between zero and 90 degrees or between negative 90 and negative 180 degrees indicates that the profile grows larger along the draft direction. An angle between zero and negative 90 degrees or between 90 and 180 degrees indicates that the profile grows smaller along the draft direction.

A Direction_element is a type of
that is a
definition for a direction.

A Edge_round is a type of
that is a convex circular arc transition between two intersecting surfaces. The blend surface is tangent to both of the adjacent surface edges. An Edge_round may be a .
Figure 30 illustrates the Edge_round with an edge_round_face that is not constant radius.
Edge_round
specifies the circular transition surface between the two edges of two surfaces.
specifies one of two surfaces the Edge_round feature will transition between.
specifies the other surfaces the Edge_round feature will transition between.

A Face_shape_element is a type of
that is a
definition for a .

A Face_shape_element_relationship is a type of
that is the sequence in which
objects are applied. The Face_shape_element_relationship defines which face is the preceding face and which face is the succeeding face.

specifies the
with the lesser precedence.

specifies the
with the highest precedence.

A Fillet is a type of
that is a concave circular arc transition between two intersecting surfaces. The blend surface may be tangent to both of the adjacent surface edges. A Fillet may be a .
Figure 31 illustrates a Fillet with a fillet face that is not constant radius.
Fillet
specifies the circular transition surface between the two edges of two surfaces.
specifies one of two surfaces the Fillet feature will transition between.
specifies the second of two surfaces the Fillet feature will transition between.

A First_chamfer_offset is an amount of length offset from a face for creating a
feature.
Figure 9 illustrates a First_chamfer_offset for a
feature.

specifies a geometric shape for one of two faces the
feature will transition between.
specifies a distance from the edge of a face to the start of the .

A Flat_hole_bottom is a type of
that is the bottom of a
that shall be flat and have no corner radius.
Figure 32 illustrates a Flat_hole_bottom for a .
Flat_hole_bottom

A Flat_slot_end_type is a type of
that is an end condition of a slot that shall be a planar shape perpendicular to both of the adjacent
wall surfaces. The intersection of the
wall surfaces and the end planar shape need not be blended by a radius.
Figure 33 illustrates a Flat_slot_end_type for a .
Flat_slot_end_type

specifies the circular arc transition between the wall of the
feature and the planar surface of the Flat_slot_end_type. The position of the first radius is where the
wall intersects the Flat_slot_end_type at a positive value along the X-axis.

specifies the circular arc transition between the wall of the
feature and the planar surface of the Flat_slot_end_type. The position of the second radius is where the
wall intersects the Flat_slot_end_type at a negative value along the X-axis.

A Flat_with_radius_hole_bottom is a type of
that the bottom of a
is flat and has corner radius that are smaller than the diameter of the .
Figure 32 illustrates a Flat_with_radius_hole_bottom for a .
specifies the radius between the side and the floor of a .

A Flat_with_taper_hole_bottom is a type of
that the bottom of a
is flat and has a planar taper from the sides of the .
Figure 32 illustrates a Flat_with_taper_hole_bottom for a .
specifies the angle between the side and the floor of a , measured along the axis inside the .

specifies the diameter of the
floor which is a diameter smaller than the initial diameter.

A Gear is a type of
that is a toothed machine part, such as a wheel or cylinder, that meshes with another toothed part to transmit motion or to change speed or direction. Each Gear is either a
or a .
Vocabulary for gears is defined in ISO 1122-1 [3] and defines the requirements for Gear. Information used to define the data associated with a gear is defined by ISO 1328-1 [4], ISO 1340 [5], and ISO 2203 [6].

ext_description.p: specifies the radial distance between the tooth tip and root circles.

note.p: Figure 34 illustrates the nominal_tooth_depth for a Gear.

ext_description.p: specifies the acute angle between a radial line passing through the point of intersection of the profile with the reference circle and a tangent to the profile at that point.

note.p: Figure 35 illustrates a reference_preassure_angle for a Gear.

ext_description.p: specifies the quotient of the rack shift divided by the module. The rack shift specifies the distance measured along a common normal between the reference cylinder of the gear and the datum plane of the basic rack, when the rack and the gear are superposed so that the flanks of a tooth of one are tangent to those of the other. By convention, the profile shift is positive when the datum plane is external to the cylinder and negative when it cuts it. This definition is valid for both external and internal gears. For internal gears, tooth profiles are considered to be those of the tooth spaces.

note.p: Figure 36 illustrates a profile_shift for a Gear.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the number of teeth in the circumference produced on the part surface.

ext_description.p: specifies a width over the toothed part of a gear, measured along a generator of the reference cylinder.

note.p: Figure 37 illustrates a face_width for a Gear.

ext_description.p: specifies the diameter of the tip circle.

note.p: Figure 38 illustrates a tip_diameter for a Gear.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the module when the value of module_or_diametrical_pitch is 'module' or the diametral pitch when the value of module_or_diametrical_pitch is 'diameter pitch'. For a spur gear, the normal_attribute is the module or diametral pitch, requiring no qualification; for a helical gear, the normal_attribute specifies the normal module or the normal diametral pitch.
specifies a base shape for applying the Gear feature.
specifies whether or not the gear teeth are applied to an internal surface or an external surface.

ext_description.p: specifies which of either the module or diametral pitch of a gear is specified by the normal_attribute.

The module of a spur gear is the quotient of the pitch at the reference surface divided by π. The normal module of a helical gear is the quotient of the normal pitch divided by π. The normal pitch is the pitch at the reference surface measured along the arc of a co-cylindrical normal helix, lying between the tooth traces of consecutive corresponding flanks.

The diametral pitch is the quotient of the number π divided by the pitch, or the quotient of the number of teeth divided by the reference diameter. The normal diametral pitch of a helical gear is the quotient of the number π divided by the normal pitch, or the quotient of the number of teeth divided by the product of the reference diameter and the cosine of the helix angle.
specifies the acceptable radius of the surface between the usable flank and the root surface. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

note.p: Figure 39 illustrates a root_fillet_radius for a Gear.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A General_boss is a type of
that is an enclosed volume bounded by an arbitrary shape.
Figure 40 illustrates the General_boss.
General_boss

specifies an outline or shape that bounds an enclosed area with no opening for a General_boss. The
specifies the area required by a General_boss. The placement of the enclosed_boundary shall be with the origin of the
at the origin of the General_boss. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the General_boss.
specifies a taper that defines the change in shape of the General_boss. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A General_closed_profile is a type of
that is an enclosed area bounded by an arbitrary shape. The orientation is defined by the explicit geometry of the shape.
Figure 41 illustrates a General_closed_profile.
General_closed_profile
specifies a closed curve that defines the arbitrary shape of the profile.

A General_cutout is a type of
that is a volume of arbitrary shape removed from the part and shall pass through two faces of the part. A General_cutout is similar in definition to a , but differ in the type of process required to manufacture.

specifies an outline or shape that is an area that may be closed or partially open. The profile specifies the area required by a General_cutout. The placement of the boundary shall be with the origin of the
at the origin of the General_cutout. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the General_cutout.

A General_open_profile is a type of
that is specified by a shape bounded by an arbitrary planar shape. The orientation is defined by the explicit geometry of the shape.
Figure 42 illustrates a General_open_profile.
General_open_profile
specifies a curve with no enclosing bounds that defines the arbitrary planar shape of the profile.

A General_outside_profile is a type of
that is specified the removal volume of raw stock or other excess material of arbitrary shape from the outside shape of the part. The General_outside_profile feature may remove material from the entire outside shape or some portion of the shape. A single part may have several General_outside_profile objects, with the Z-axes of the coordinate systems of the General_outside_profile objects pointing in any direction.
Figure 43 illustrates a General_outside_profile.
General_outside_profile

specifies a profile that identifies the outside shape of the part. The placement of the boundary shall be with the origin of the profile at the origin of the General_outside_profile feature. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the feature.

A General_path_feature_component is a type of
that is a direction of travel along an arbitrary curve.
Figure 44 illustrates a
feature with a
and a General_path_feature_component. The path has the same orientation as the
feature. The orientation of the profile positions it to the orientation of the
feature. The
has orientation to position it at the same position as the
feature.
General_path_feature_component
specifies a continues set of curves that define an arbitrary direction of travel.

A General_pattern is a type of
that is a base shape component and a list of arbitrary placements to arrange identical copies of the base feature. The placement of all instances of the base feature are relative to the
coordinate system.
Figure 45 illustrates a General_pattern of
features.
General_pattern

specifies a set of axis and positions to place a base feature in the General_pattern. A General_pattern is defined as one base feature and many placements allowing the base feature to be placed several times in a random pattern. There may be more than one feature_placement for a General_pattern.

A General_pocket is a type of
that is a volume of arbitrary shape removed from the part.
Figure 46 illustrates a General_pocket with a
and a pocket depth that defines the highest point of the pocket.
General_pocket

specifies an amount of material that is not to be removed from the pocket. The
feature defines the shape of the material that is to remain in the pocket.

specifies an outline or shape that is an area that may be closed or partially open. The profile specifies the area required by a General_pocket. The placement of the boundary shall be with the origin of the
at the origin of the General_pocket. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the General_pocket.

A General_pocket_bottom_condition is a type of
that specifies an enclosed area bounded by an arbitrary shape.
Figure 46 illustrates the General_pocket_bottom_condition applied to a
with an .

specifies the face at the bottom of a
feature, adjacent to all the pocket walls.
specifies the amount of curvature for an arc between the bottom and the sides of a pocket feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A General_profile_floor is a type of
that specifies an enclosed area bounded by an arbitrary shape.
Figure 81 illustrates a
with a General_profile_floor.

specifies the face at the bottom of a General_profile_floor feature, adjacent to all the
walls.

A General_removal_volume is a type of
that is an enclosed volume of arbitrary shape that shall be removed from the part. The position and orientation shall be determined from the shape defining geometry.
Figure 47 illustrates a General_removal_volume.
General_removal_volume
specifies the arbitrary shape to be removed.

A General_revolution is a type of
that is an arbitrary planar shape swept one complete revolution about an axis. The arbitrary planar shape shall be finite in length, coplanar with the axis of revolution, and shall not intersect the axis of revolution. The General_revolution may be either an outer shape of a part or a volume removal, depending on the material direction.
Figure 48 illustrates a General_revolution for an outer shape, the material direction points to the material side. Figure 49 illustrates a General_revolution for a volume removal.
General_revolution for an outer shape
General_revolution for a volume removal

specifies an outline or shape that shall be revolved about an axis. The
specifies the outer edge shape required by a General_revolution. The placement of the outer_edge_shape shall be on the Y-axis of the General_revolution at a specified distance away from the origin of the General_revolution. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the Y-axis and Z-axis of the General_revolution.

A General_rib_top_floor is a type of
that specifies an enclosed area bounded by an arbitrary shape. The floor defining shapes may be defined in a particular sequence.
specifies a set of faces at the bottom of a . The order of the faces is achieved using a .

A General_shape_profile is a type of
that is a volume of arbitrary shape which defines a portion of the part.

specifies the outline of the
feature. The outline defines an area that may or may not be entirely enclosed. The placement of the profile_boundary shall be with the origin of the , that defines the profile, at the origin of the General_shape_profile. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the General_shape_profile.

A General_top_condition is a type of
that specifies an enclosed area bounded by an arbitrary shape that defines the top of a
feature.

specifies a face at the top of a
feature, adjacent to the
sides.

A Groove is a type of
that is a narrow channel or depression that is swept through one complete revolution about an axis.
Figure 50 illustrates two Groove features. The face shape that has the Groove applied to it is determined by the profile orientation.
Groove

specifies an outline or shape that shall be revolved about an axis. The
specifies the sweep shape required by a Groove. The placement of the profile shall be along the X-axis of the Groove at a specified distance away from the origin. The orientation of the
is independent of the orientation of the Groove feature. The Groove feature may be defined on different faces of a part depending on the orientation of the profile.

A Helical_bevel_gear is a type of
where the tooth traces are non-cylindrical helices, joining the definitions of as of a
and a .
specifies the acute angle between the tangent to the tooth trace of a straight helical gear and the straight generator of the reference cylinder on which it lies.

ext_description.p: specifies a description of whether the gear teeth are right or left handed.

Right hand teeth are teeth whose successive transverse profiles show clockwise displacement with increasing distance from an observer looking along the straight line generators of the reference surface

Left hand teeth are teeth whose successive transverse profiles show anti-clockwise displacement with increasing distance from an observer looking along the straight line generators of the reference surface.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Helical_gear is a type of
that is a cylindrical gear whose tooth traces are helices.
Figure 51 illustrates the Helical_gear.
Helical_gear

ext_description.p: specifies a description of whether the gear teeth are right or left handed.

Right hand teeth are teeth whose successive transverse profiles show clockwise displacement with increasing distance from an observer looking along the straight line generators of the reference surface.

Left hand teeth are teeth whose successive transverse profiles show anti-clockwise displacement with increasing distance from an observer looking along the straight line generators of the reference surface.

note.p: Figure 52 illustrates left or right hand teeth for a Helical_gear.

ext_description.p: the acute angle between the tangent to the tooth trace of a straight helical gear and the straight generator of the reference cylinder on which it lies.

note.p: Figure 53 illustrates a reference_helix_angle for a Helical_gear.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Hole is a type of
that is the removal of a cylindrical volume from a part. Each Hole is either a , a , or a . The Hole may be positioned at its bottom with the Z-axis in the direction out of the Hole or at a position at the top of the hole with the Z-axis in the direction into the part.
An Instanced_manufacturing_feature is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the Instanced_manufacturing_feature.

A Knurl is a type of
that is a scoring pattern made by a series of small ridges or beads on a metal surface. Each Knurl is either a
or a .
Figure 54 illustrates a Knurl types.
Knurl
specifies the placement and length of a surface to apply a Knurl feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a base shape for applying the Knurl feature.

A Linear_path_feature_component is a type of
that is a direction of travel along a line.
Figure 55 illustrates a
with a Linear_path_feature_component. This path has the same orientation as the feature.
Linear_path_feature_component
specifies the length of the path.
specifies a vector which indicates the the direction of the path starting from the path placement.

A Linear_profile is a type of
that is a straight line of a specified length. The Linear_profile shall have orientation parallel to the X-axis.
Figure 56 illustrates a Linear_profile that is being applied to the
feature.
Linear_profile
specifies the length of the profile.

A Location_element is a type of
that is a
representation for a reference point.

A Loop_slot_end_type is an end conditions of a slot that is a closed loop. The start point and end point of the
are the same point, the
has no end openings.

A Machining_feature is a type of
that identifies a volume of material that shall be removed to obtain the final part geometry from the initial stock. Machining_feature requires both direction and location in placing them on a part. Each Machining_feature is either a , a , a , a , a , an , a , a , or a .
specifies the position and orientation of a Machining_feature relative to the base shape for a part.

A Path_feature_component is a type of . A Path_feature_component is a continuous set of curves that define a direction of travel. These curves do not intersect or duplicate themselves. A Path_feature_component shall have its own orientation which may be the same orientation as the
which requires it as a part of a feature definition. The orientation of a Path_feature_component may be the same orientation as the . Each Path_feature_component is either a , a , or a .
specifies where to locate the Path_feature_component.

A Manufacturing_feature is a type of
that identifies the types of features necessary to manufacture a machined part. Each Manufacturing_feature is either a , a , or a .

A Manufacturing_feature_group is a collection of manufacturing features with a usage identification. A Manufacturing_feature_group shall allow for the collection of collections.
A Manufacturing_feature_group may be used to group together all of the hold down holes for a part.
specifies identification for the Manufacturing_feature_group.
specifies additional text information about the Manufacturing_feature_group.

specifies the list of
or the Manufacturing_feature_group to be grouped.

A Marking_feature is a type of
that is one or more text characters on a surface of a part. Each Marking_feature is either a
or a .
specifies the characters that will be applied to the part.
specifies a base shape for applying the Marking_feature feature.

A Multi_axis_feature is a type of
that identifies milling features for a part, and not turned features. Each Multi_axis_feature may be one of the following: a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , or a .

specifies a planar limitation for a feature. No portion of the feature shall exist beyond this planar definition. The normal to the plane shall be in the direction away from the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Ngon_profile is a type of
that is an enclosed area bounded by three or more connected straight line sides. The orientation is at the center of the profile with one side of the ngon parallel to the X-axis crossing the Y-axis at a negative value.
Figure 57 illustrates the Ngon_profile.
Ngon_profile
specifies specifies the size of either the circumscribed diameter, or the diameter across the flats.
specifies how many sides are needed for the Ngon.
specifies the size of an arc blend between two sides of the ngon. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the type of diameter being used to define the Ngon_profile. Circumscribed is the diameter that the polygon with any number of sides fits inside of, with the corners on the circle that defines the diameter. Across flats, is the diameter that fits inside of the Ngon_profile with the sides of the shape being tangent to the circle that defines the diameter.

An Open_profile is a type of
that is an outline or shape with no enclosing or confining bounds. The open ends of the profile may extend infinitely. Each Open_profile is either a , a , a , a , a , a , or a .

specifies a planar limitation for a feature. No portion of the profile shall exist beyond this planar definition. The normal to the plane shall be in the direction away from the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

An Open_slot is a type of
that has a course of travel defined by a
that is open and has openings.
specifies a 3D space curve, that when combine with a , creates the shape of the .
specifies the type of implicit shape at the ends of the .

An Open_slot_end_type is a type of
that is an end condition of a slot that shall pass through the end of the part.
Figure 58 illustrates a slot with two Open_slot_end_type objects.
Open_slot_end_type

An Outer_diameter is a type of
that is a sweeping of an outline specified by a line segment one complete revolution about an axis. The line is finite in length, coplanar with the axis. An Outer_diameter may have a constant diameter around the axis of rotation, or it may be tapered.
Figure 59 illustrates the Outer_diameter with and without a taper.
Outer_diameter
specifies the size of a Outer_diameter feature, measured along the feature's axis.
specifies the maximum diametric size of an Outer_diameter feature.
specifies the constant change in the Outer_diameter along the feature length.

An Outer_diameter_to_shoulder is a type of
that is a sweeping of a shape one complete revolution about an axis. The shape shall be specified by two lines that connect at a point and extend infinitely. The enclosed angle shall be smaller than a straight angle. The intersection of the two lines need not be blended with a radius.
Figure 60 illustrates the Outer_diameter_to_shoulder.
Outer_diameter_to_shoulder
specifies the size of an Outer_diameter_to_shoulder, measured along the feature's axis.
specifies the size of the part at the point of the Vee, or where the two sides come together, swept about an axis of rotation.

specifies an outline or shape that shall be revolved about an axis. The
specifies the revolved shape required by an Outer_diameter_to_shoulder. The placement of the profile shall be along the X-axis of the Outer_diameter_to_shoulder at a specified distance away from the origin. The orientation of the Y-axis of the
shall be the same as the Y-axis of the Outer_diameter_to_shoulder and the X-axis of the
shall be the same as the Z-axis of the Outer_diameter_to_shoulder.

An Outer_round is a type of
that is an outline or significant shape that is swept through a complete revolution about an axis. Each Outer_round is either an
or an . The axis of revolution shall be the same as the Z-axis of the feature.

A Partial_area_definition is a limitations of a surface for applying a .
and
features are applied to cylindrical shapes. Partial_area_definition places a limitation on how much and where to apply the feature on the cylindrical shape.
Figure 8 and Figure 26 illustrates a
with a Partial_area_definition. The drawing call out '5.12 MIN.THREAD' defines the amount of cylindrical shape that has the thread applied.

specifies the dimension along a surface to apply a feature. A
is a type of
that is applied to a surface. The dimensional distance limits the length along the surface axis for defining these feature objects. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the length of the thread which is usable by the feature. When applied to a knurl the effective_length defines the overall length of the knurl.
specifies where to locate the Partial_area_definition.

A Partial_circular_path_feature_component is a type of
that is a direction of travel along an arc of constant radius around an axis. The path shall begin and end at different points on the arc.
Figure 61 illustrates two
feature with a
and a Partial_circular_path_feature_component.
Partial_circular_path_feature_component
specifies the size of the angle to define an arc shaped path.

A Partial_circular_profile is a type of
that is specified by an arc. The arc shall be a constant radius swept about a point. The orientation of the profile shall be positioned at the origin of the arc, with one end point of the arc on the X-axis.
Figure 62 illustrates a Partial_circular_profile.
Partial_circular_profile
specifies the size of the angle to define an circular shaped profile.
specifies the size of the arc to define a Partial_circular_profile.

A Partial_circular_shape_profile is a type of
that defines a volume that is not enclosed on all sides.

specifies the outline of the
feature. The outline defines an area that shall be circular and shall not be enclosed. The placement of the open_boundary shall be with the origin of the , that defines the profile, at the origin of the Partial_circular_shape_profile. The X-axis and Yaxis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the Partial_circular_shape_profile.

A Path_element is a type of
that is a continuous set of geometric curve that represent the path for a particular .

A Planar_element is a type of
that is a flat surface.
specifies the vector which indicates the normal of a plane being defined for the planar surface.
specifies the position of the planar surface.

A Planar_face is a type of
that is an unbounded planar cut of a part. The Planar_face shall have an orientation such that the Z-axis is the direction away from the part.
Figure 63 illustrates the Planar_face.
Planar_face

specifies a line with direction and magnitude that when swept along a path defines the area on a part for volume removal. The orientation and placement of the
shall be the same as the Planar_face.

specifies a straight line with magnitude and direction. The placement and orientation of the
shall be the same as the Planar_face feature.
specifies the complete or partial outside final shape of the part after the planar cut has been applied. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the direction of material removal from the Planar_face feature.

specifies an amount of material that is not to be removed from the Planar_face. The
or
feature define the shape of the material that is to remain in the Planar_face.

ext_description.p:
specifies a measured distance from the bottom of a point that is outside of the Planar_face. The removal_depth places a limitation on the Planar_face definition so not to interfere with other features that might be nearby. The placement and orientation of the
that defines removal_depth shall be the same as the Planar_face. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: If a portion of the part should extend over the top of the Planar_face, the depth value would not interfere with it.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Planar_pocket_bottom_condition is a type of
that characterizes the bottom of a pocket which is flat.
Figure 73 illustrates the
with a Planar_pocket_bottom_condition. Figure 69 illustrates a
with a Planar_pocket_bottom_condition.

ext_description.p: specifies the vector which indicates the normal of a plane being defined for the bottom of a pocket.

note.p:
Figure 73 illustrates the
with a Planar_pocket_bottom_condition and a floor_normal.

ext_description.p: specifies the position of the bottom of a pocket feature for a planar floor.

note.p:
Figure 73 illustrates the
with a Planar_pocket_bottom_condition and a floor_location.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the amount of curvature for an arc between the bottom and the sides of a
feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Planar_profile_floor is a type of
that characterizes the bottom of a
feature which is flat.
Figure 81 illustrates a
with a Planar_profile_floor.

specifies a planar floor for the
feature. The normal to the plane shall be in the direction away from the Planar_profile_floor feature.

A Planar_rib_top_floor is a type of
that is the bottom of a
which is flat.

specifies a planar floor for the
feature. The normal to the plane shall be in the direction away from the
feature.

specifies the complete or partial outside final shape of the
feature.

A Planar_top_condition is a type of
for a
that is flat.
Figure 10 illustrates a
with a Planar_top_condition.
specifies the vector that indicates the normal of a plane being defined for the top of a boss.
specifies the position of the top of a boss feature for a planar top.

A Pocket is a type of
that is a volume with a specific shape, removed from the part. The sides of a pocket may be parallel to the pocket's orientation vector coming out of the pocket or the sides may be tapered. The placement may be at the bottom of the Pocket with the Z-axis in the direction out of the pocket or at the top of the pocket with the Z-axis in the direction into the pocket. Each Pocket is either a , a , a , a , or a .
specifies a radius shape blend between a Pocket and the surrounding part surface at the top of the Pocket.
specifies a taper that defines the change in shape of the Pocket. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the shape of the bottom of a Pocket feature.

ext_description.p:
specifies a measured distance from the bottom of a pocket to a point that is outside of the pocket feature. The pocket_depth places a limitation on the Pocket definition so not to interfere with other features that might be nearby. The placement and orientation of the
that defines pocket_depth shall be the same as the Pocket feature.
ext_description.example: If a portion of the part should extend over the top of the pocket feature, the depth value would not interfere with it.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Pocket_bottom_condition is a bottom state for a pocket. The
bottom may be flat, or any arbitrary shape, or the pocket may pass through the part. Each Pocket_bottom_condition is either a , or a .

ext_description.p:
specifies a boolean value of TRUE if the Pocket_bottom_condition is positioned at the start of the of the defining
for the , and a value of FALSE if it is at the end of the of the defining
for the .

note.p: Figure 64 illustrates the start_or_end attribute for a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Profile is a planar outline used in the definition of a feature. A Profile may be either open or closed. A Profile shall be in the X-Y plane and have an orientation that will position it in reference to a , which may require a profile as a part of its definition. Each Profile is either a
or an .

A Profile_feature is a type of
that is the removal of excess material from the boundary shape of a part. Each Profile_feature is either a , or a .

ext_description.p:
specifies an implicit 2D line definition that, when combined with a , creates the shape of the Profile_feature. The profile_swept_shape places a limitation on the Profile_feature definition so not to interfere with other features that might be nearby. The placement of the
that defines profile_swept_shape shall be the same as the Profile_feature feature. The orientation shall be with the Z-axis toward the direction of travel of the profile boundary, and the Y-axis in the direction away from the part material.
ext_description.example: If a portion of the part should extend over the top of the Profile_feature, the depth value would not interfere with it.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Profile_floor is a bottom condition for a . The Profile_floor may be flat, or any arbitrary shape. Each Profile_floor is either a
or a .

specifies the radius of curvature for an arc between the bottom and the sides of a
feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a boolean value of TRUE if the Profile_floor is positioned at the end of a , and a value of FALSE if it is at the start of the .

A Protrusion is a type of
that is an arbitrary shape that extends out from a surrounding surface.
Figure 65 illustrates a Protrusion.
Protrusion
specifies the arbitrary shape that defines the shape of a Protrusion.

A Radiused_slot_end_type is a type of
that is an end condition of a slot that shall be a cylindrical shape tangent to both of the adjacent
wall surfaces.
Figure 66 illustrates the Radiused_slot_end_type.
Radiused_slot_end_type

A Recess is a type of
that has a bottom, and a floor radius, but the sides of the pocket shall be no higher that the floor radius. The Recess shall not pass entirely through the part but shall have a floor bottom. The type of bottom condition shall be a .
Figure 67 illustrates the Recess. A Recess is commonly found in the bottom of a
feature.
Recess
specifies the shape of the bottom of a Recess feature. The bottom_condition shall not pass entirely through the part.

specifies an amount of material that is not to be removed from the recess. The
or
feature define the shape of the material that is to remain in the recess.

specifies an outline or shape that is an enclosed area that shall be a close profile. The profile specifies the area required by a Recess. The placement of the fillet_boundary shall be with the origin of the
at the origin of the Recess. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the Recess.

A Rectangular_boss is a type of
that is an enclosed volume with opposite sides that are equal in length.
Figure 68 illustrates the Rectangular_boss. The lengths are determined in the profile view of the .
Rectangular_boss

specifies an enclosed area bounded by four sides with opposite sides equal in length and corners at 90 degrees. The orientation is at the center of the rectangle, the X-axis is parallel to the length of the rectangle and the Y-axis is parallel to the width.
specifies a taper that defines the change in shape of the Rectangular_boss. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Rectangular_closed_pocket is a type of
that is an enclosed volume with opposite sides that are equal in length.
Figure 69 illustrates the Rectangular_closed_pocket.
Rectangular_closed_pocket

specifies an amount of material that is not to be removed from the pocket. The
feature defines the shape of the material that is to remain in the pocket.

specifies the outline or shape that is an enclosed area that has a completely closed profile. The profile specifies the area required by a Rectangular_closed_pocket. The placement of the closed_boundary shall be with the origin of the profile at the origin of the pocket. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the Rectangular_closed_pocket.

A Rectangular_closed_profile is a type of
that is an enclosed area bounded by four sides with opposite sides equal in length and corners at 90 degrees. The orientation is at the center of the rectangle, the X-axis is parallel to the length of the rectangle and the Y-axis is parallel to the width.
Figure 70 illustrates the Rectangular_closed_profile.
Rectangular_closed_profile
specifies the length of the side, along the Y-axis, of the rectangular profile.
specifies the length of the side, along the X-axis, of the rectangular profile.
specifies the size of the arc in all four corners of the rectangular profile. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Rectangular_closed_shape_profile is a type of
that is an enclosed volume with opposite sides that are equal in length.

specifies the outline or shape that is an enclosed area that has a completely closed profile. The profile specifies the area required by a Rectangular_closed_shape_profile. The placement of the closed_boundary shall be with the origin of the profile at the origin of the profile. The X-axis and Yaxis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the Rectangular_closed_shape_profile.

A Rectangular_offset_pattern is a modification of the placement of a particular occurrence of the base feature in a
relative to its expected placement.
Figure 71 illustrates the Rectangular_offset_pattern.
Rectangular_offset_pattern
specifies the direction to offset a base feature from its original position in the rectangular pattern.

specifies the amount of offset from a feature location in a
for placing another feature.
specifies the unique identification for a feature in a column of multiple features.
specifies the unique identification for a feature in a row of multiple features.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Rectangular_offset_pattern is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Rectangular_offset_pattern as its . There shall exist one or more Rectangular_patterns for the Rectangular_offset_pattern.

A Rectangular_omit_pattern is an omission of a particular occurrence of the base feature in an .
Figure 72 illustrates Rectangular_omit_pattern.
Rectangular_omit_pattern
specifies the unique identification for a feature in a row of multiple features.
specifies the unique identification for a feature in a column of multiple features.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Rectangular_omit_pattern is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Rectangular_omit_pattern as its . There shall exist one or more Rectangular_patterns for the Rectangular_omit_pattern.

A Rectangular_open_pocket is a type of
that is an open profile with opposite sides that are of equal length and with one side that does not make contact with the part. The open boundary is defined by a
such that, when swept along a path, the profile defines the area on a part for volume removal. The orientation and placement of the
shall be the same as the Rectangular_open_pocket.
Figure 73 illustrates the Rectangular_open_pocket.
Rectangular_open_pocket

specifies an amount of material that is not to be removed from the pocket. The
feature defines the shape of the material that is to remain in the pocket.

specifies the outline or shape that is an enclosed area that is open on one side. The profile specifies the area required by a Rectangular_open_pocket. The placement of the open boundary shall be with the origin of the profile at the origin of the pocket. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the Rectangular_open_pocket.

A Rectangular_open_shape_profile is a type of
that is an open profile with opposite sides that are of equal length and with one side that does not make contact with the part.

specifies the outline or shape that is an enclosed area that is open on one side. The profile specifies the area required by a Rectangular_open_shape_profile. The placement of the open_boundary shall be with the origin of the profile at the origin of the feature. The X-axis and Y-axis of the profile shall be the same as the X-axis and Y-axis of the Rectangular_open_shape_profile.

A Rectangular_pattern is a type of
that is a shape component arranged in a pattern of rows and columns.
Figure 74 illustrates the Rectangular_pattern.
Rectangular_pattern

specifies the definition to offset any number of base features from the Rectangular_pattern. The relocated_base_feature need not be specified for a particular Rectangular_pattern. There may be more than one relocated_base_feature for a Rectangular_pattern.

specifies the definition to remove any number of base features from the Rectangular_pattern. The missing_base_feature need not be specified for a particular Rectangular_pattern. There may be more than one missing_base_feature for a Rectangular_pattern.
specifies the linear direction for defining the columns of the pattern.
specifies the amount of space between features in a Rectangular_pattern row.
specifies the number of rows for placing features in the Rectangular_pattern.
specifies the linear direction for defining the rows of the pattern.
specifies the number of columns for placing features in the Rectangular_pattern.
specifies the amount of space between features in a Rectangular_pattern column.

A Replicate_base is a type of feature to be used as a base feature for reproduction. The Replicate_base shall have a base defined by either a
or a .

specifies the feature that will be reproduced by the . The base_feature may be either a
or a .

A Replicate_feature is a type of
that is a basis shape, and the arrangement of identical copies of that base shape. Each base shape is a
oriented to the first defined position of a pattern. The patterns describe how to replicate that feature to different placements on the part. Each Replicate_feature is either a , a , or a .
specifies the position and orientation of a Replicate_feature relative to the base shape for a part.
specifies the feature that will be replicated by the Replicate_feature.

A Revolved_feature is a type of
that is a sweeping of a planar shape one complete revolution about an axis. The planar shape shall be finite in length, coplanar with the axis of revolution, and shall not intersect the axis of revolution. The axis of revolution shall be the same as the Z-axis of the feature. The Revolved_feature may be either an outer shape of a part or a volume removal, depending on the material direction. Each Revolved_feature is either a , a , a , or a .
specifies the distance from the axis of rotation to define placement of the profile that will be swept about the axis.
specifies the material direction. The direction of removal indicates the direction the material will be removed from the part.

A Revolved_flat is a type of
that is the sweeping of a straight line about an axis.
Figure 75 illustrates the Revolved_flat.
Revolved_flat

specifies the line with direction and magnitude that when revolved about an axis defines the area on a part for volume removal. The placement of the profile shall be along the X-axis of the Revolved_flat at a specified distance away from the origin. The Y-axis orientation of the
shall be the same as the Y-axis of the Revolved_flat, the X-axis and Z-axis are independent of the orientation of the Revolved_flat feature.

A Revolved_round is a type of
that is the sweeping of an arc about an axis.
Figure 76 illustrates the Revolved_round.
Revolved_round

specifies the arc that when revolved about an axis defines the area on a part for volume removal. The placement of the profile shall be along the X-axis of the Revolved_round at a specified distance away from the origin. The Z-axis orientation of the
shall be the same as the Y-axis of the Revolved_round, the X-axis and Y-axis are independent of the orientation of the Revolved_round feature.

A Rib_top is a type of
that is the removal of a volume to a floor with no sides, or floor radius. Rib_top features may adjoin with another Rib_top feature.
The material that separates two pockets on a part is an example of a rib. The top surface of that rib would be an example of a Rib_top.
Figure 77 illustrates the Rib_top feature.
Rib_top
specifies a vector that points in the general direction away from the material for a Rib_top.
specifies the bottom state of a Rib_top. The floor may be flat or any arbitrary shape.
A Rib_top_floor is a bottom restriction for a . The bottom may be flat, or any arbitrary shape. Each Rib_top_floor is either a , or a .

A Round_hole is a type of
that is a removal of a volume of cylindrical shape from a part. A Round_hole need not be tapered. The orientation is at a point in the bottom of the hole. The Z-axis is along the centerline with the direction out of the hole.
Figure 78 illustrates the Round_hole with and without a taper.
Round_hole

specifies some amount of distance from the bottom of a Round_hole to a point that is outside of the Round_hole feature. Hole depth places a limitation on the Round_hole depth definition so not to interfere with other features that might be nearby. The placement and orientation of the
shall be the same as the Round_hole feature.

specifies a distance across a Round_hole. The placement and orientation of the
shall be the same as the Round_hole feature.
specifies the taper that defines the change in shape of the Round_hole. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the shape of the bottom of a Round_hole feature. Each bottom_condition may be one of the following: a , or a .

A Rounded_end is a type of
that is a partially circular shape passed along a linear path.
Figure 79 illustrates the Rounded_end.
Rounded_end

specifies the arc that when swept along a path defines the area on a part for volume removal. The placement and orientation of the
that defines the partial_circular_boundary shall be the same as the Rounded_end feature.

specifies a straight line with magnitude and direction. The placement and orientation of the
that defines the course_of_travel shall be the same as the Rounded_end feature.

A Rounded_u_profile is a type of
that is a shape bounded by two parallel lines and a semicircle. Each line begins at the end point of the semicircle. The lines are tangent to the circle and extend infinitely. The profile is positioned with the opening in the direction of the Y-axis. The orientation is at a point on the profile the farthest distance from the opening measured along the Y-axis. The X-axis is tangent to the semicircle.
Figure 80 illustrates the Rounded_u_profile.
Rounded_u_profile
specifies the distance across a Rounded_u_profile.
specifies the distance, measured along the Y axis, from the profile origin to the top of the profile. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Second_chamfer_offset is a type of
that is the amount of length offset from a face for creating a
feature.
Figure 9 illustrates a Second_chamfer_offset for a
feature.

specifies the offset value from the edge of a face to the
face.

A Second_chamfer_parameter is a choice of methods for creating a
feature. A
requires an offset and the choice between a second offset or an angle. Each Second_chamfer_parameter is either a
or a .

specifies one of two faces the
feature will transition between. The first face is specified by .

A Shape_profile is a type of
that is the removal volume of raw stock or other excess material from the boundary shape of a part. The sides of a profile may be parallel to the profile's orientation vector, or may be parallel with an offset amount. The placement may be at the bottom of the profile with the Z-axis in the direction toward the top of the profile, or at the top of the profile with the Z-axis in the direction toward the bottom of the profile. The bottom of the boundary shape is limited by a floor condition. Each Shape_profile is either a , a , a , a , or a .
Figure 81 illustrates a Shape_profile.
Shape_profile

specifies the shape of the bottom of a Shape_profile feature. The floor_condition is either a
or a .
specifies a vector that points in the general direction away from the material for a Shape_profile.

A Slot is a type of
that is a channel or depression with continuous direction of travel. The Slot origin shall be located at one end of the slot, the Z-axis shall indicate the direction of the slot, and the Y-axis shall indicate the direction away from the part. Each Slot is either a
or an .
Figure 82 illustrates types of Slot.
Slot
A Slot_end_type is the end conditions of a slot. A slot shall have two ends, each end shall be open or closed. Each Slot_end_type is either a , an , a , or a .

specifies a value of 'FIRST' if the Slot_end_type is closest to the positioning point of a
or 'SECOND' if it is the farthest away.

A Spherical_cap is a type of
that is circular about an axis of rotation. A Spherical_cap consists of all points a given distance from a point constituting its center. The Z-axis shall be in the direction away from the material.
Figure 83 illustrates the Spherical_cap.
Spherical_cap

specifies the size of an angle from an axis for defining a portion of a sphere to use as a Spherical_cap feature. The X-axis defines the start of the Spherical_cap and the internal_angle is measured from this axis.
specifies the constant distance from a point for defining a sphere.

A Spherical_hole_bottom is a type of
that is a bottom of a
which is concentric about an axis and defined by a radius. The radius is the same as the radius of the hole.
Figure 84 illustrates the Spherical_hole_bottom.
Spherical_hole_bottom
specifies the radius at the bottom of the .

A Spur_gear is a type of
that is a cylindrical gear whose tooth traces are straight line generators of the reference cylinder.
Figure 85 illustrates the Spur_gear.
Spur_gear

A Square_u_profile is a type of
that is a shape bounded by three lines. One is the base line and has a defined length. The other two lines begin at the ends of the base line, and extend infinitely at any angle to the base line greater than zero degrees and less than 180 degrees. The two lines may also be at right angle to the base line. The corners of the Square_u_profile need not be blended by a radius.
Figure 86 illustrates the Square_u_profile.
Square_u_profile
specifies the size of an angle between one side of the profile and the base.
specifies the size of an angle between the second side of the profile and the base.
specifies the radius shape blend between one side of the profile and the base. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the radius shape blend between the second side of the profile and the base. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the distance, measured along the Y axis, from the profile origin to the top of the profile.
specifies the size of the base line for a Square_u_profile. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Step is a type of
that is a linear sweep of a shape. The shape shall be specified by two lines that connect at a point and extend infinitely. The enclosed angle shall be smaller than 180 degrees. The intersection of the two lines need not be blended with a radius.
Figure 87 illustrates the Step.
Step

specifies the
that when swept along a path defines the area on a part for volume removal. The placement and orientation of the
shall be the same as the Step feature.

specifies the straight line with magnitude and direction. The placement and orientation of the
shall be the same as the Step feature.

specifies an amount of material that is not to be removed from the step. The
or
feature define the shape of the material that is to remain in the pocket.

A Straight_bevel_gear is a type of
that have straight tooth elements, which if extended, would pass through the point of intersection of their axes.

A Straight_knurl is a type of
that is typified by knurl scoring that is parallel to the axis of the scored surface.
Figure 88 illustrates the Straight_knurl.
Straight_knurl

A Tee_profile is a type of
the cross-section of which has the shape of the twentieth letter of the English alphabet in capital form. The first line has a defined length. The second line begins at the midpoint of the first line and is perpendicular to it. The second line extends infinitely. The corners of the Tee_profile need not be blended by a radius. The profile is positioned with the opening in the direction of the Y-axis. The orientation is at a point on the profile the farthest distance from the opening measured along the Y-axis. The X-axis is tangent to the bottom of the profile.
Figure 89 illustrates the Tee_profile.
Tee_profile
specifies the angular measurement for creating a chamfer on the open end of a Tee_profile.
specifies the angular measurement for creating a chamfer between the stem and the cross bar parts of a Tee_profile.
specifies the distance from the edge of the Tee stem to create a chamfer on the open end of a Tee_profile.
specifies a distance from the edge of the Tee stem to create a chamfer a distance from the edge of a surface to the finish of a chamfer.
specifies the depth dimension of the Tee stem.
specifies the arc size for blending the sides of a Tee_profile cross bar. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the width dimension of the Tee stem.
specifies the width dimension of the Tee cross bar size.
specifies the depth dimension of the Tee cross bar size.

A Thread is a type of
that is a ridge of uniform section on the form of a helix on the external or internal surface of a cylinder. Each Thread is either a
or a .
Figure 90 illustrates the Thread and Figure 8, Figure 26 illustrates Thread attributes.
Threads can be used to screw parts together.
An outside thread might be on an , an inside thread might be in a .
Thread
specifies the limitations to be applied on the Thread feature.
specifies part of a Thread with an incomplete thread form. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the value for the type of fit specification for the thread. These types are distinguished from each other by the amount of tolerance and allowance.
ext_description.example: Examples of ANSI fit class are: 1A, 2A, and 3A which apply to external threads only, and 1B, 2B, and 3B which apply to internal threads only.

ext_description.p: specifies the definition of the shape of the thread. Various forms of threads are used to hold parts together, to adjust parts with reference to each other, or to transmit power.
ext_description.example: Examples of form are: metric, square, unified, sharp V, buttress, standard worm, and knuckle.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the density of threads per inch when used with English unit of measure and is the thread pitch when used with metric unit of measure. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a description of whether the thread is right or left handed. When viewed toward an end, a right hand winds in a clockwise direction and a left hand winds in a counterclockwise direction.
specifies whether or not the thread is applied as an internal thread or an external thread.
specifies additional text information that describes a Thread.
specifies the size designation, typically a nominal major diameter, that identifies the thread within a standard thread series. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the physical shape of the part that will define where the Thread feature will be applied.

ext_description.p: specifies the value for the type of fit specification for the thread. These types are distinguished from each other by the amount of tolerance and allowance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: In the case of ISO metric screw threads, where the tolerance class for the major diameter differs to that for the pitch diameter, it is necessary to have two fit classes in order to specify the thread.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Thread_runout is a portion of a thread where the thread form is incomplete. It is usually characterised by an approximately linear variation in thread depth from full to nothing, over a given length. A Thread_runout is typically a by-product of the thread cutting process, but may be a design feature of functional importance.
An example of a thread runout is when used as a locking mechanism for a plain stud.
specifes the length of the runout.

specifies whether the length_of_runout is quantified by a dimension or a number of thread pitches. A value of true specifies the runout length is specified as a number of pitches. A value of false specifies the runout length is specified by a dimension.

specifies whether or not the thread
is inclusive or exclusive of the length of the runout (length_of_runout). A value of true specifies the runout length as included within the thread . A value of false specifies the runout length as additional to the thread .

A Through_bottom_condition is a selection type of
that shall pass through two faces of a part; the depth is specified by the feature. The Through_bottom_condition length is specified by the size of the
feature.
Figure 91 illustrates the Through_bottom_condition.
Through_bottom_condition

A Through_pocket_bottom_condition is a pocket that passes through two faces of a part; the depth is defined by the
of the
feature.
Figure 46 illustrates Through_pocket_bottom_condition.

A Through_profile_floor is a
which passes through two faces of a part; the depth is specified by the size of the feature.

A Transition_feature is a type of
that is a transition area between two surfaces. This feature differs from
objects in that it requires no orientation for placement. Each Transition_feature may be either a , an , or a .

A Turned_knurl is a type of
that is a scoring pattern consisting of a series of shallow cuts on a cylindrical surface. Each Turned_knurl is either a , a , or a .
Figure 92 illustrates the Turned_knurl.
A knurl may be used to aid in gripping a part.
Turned_knurl
specifies the size of the part after a knurl has been applied.
specifies the ratio of the number of teeth in the circumference to the nominal diameter.
specifies the dimension of a radius between teeth on a knurling tool. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the number of teeth in the circumference produced on the part surface. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the depth from the crest of a tooth to the point where two teeth intersect. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies size of the part before a knurl is applied to it.

A Vee_profile is a type of
that is a shape bounded by two lines that connect at a point and extends infinitely. The enclosed angle is less than 180 degrees. The intersection of the two lines need not be blended with a radius. The profile is positioned with the opening in the direction of the Y axis. The Y-axis intersects the angle between the two sides.
Figure 93 illustrates the Vee_profile.
Vee_profile
specifies the size of the blend radius at the point of the V, or where the two sides come together. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the size of the angle between the two sides of the Vee_profile. The angle shall be greater than 0 and not more than 180 degrees.
specifies the size of the angle between one side of the Vee_profile and the x-axis of the local coordinate system that defines the Vee_profile orientation on the part.
indicates the distance, as measured from the profile origin, along the side of the vee located by the tilt_angle parameter. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
indicates the distance, as measured from the profile origin, along the side of the vee located by the sum of the tilt_angle and profile_angle. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Woodruff_slot_end_type is a type of
that is an end condition of a slot that shall be a radius tangent to the
bottom, and curved upward about an axis.
Figure 94 illustrates the Woodruff_slot_end_type.
Woodruff_slot_end_type

specifies the size of the radius swept about an axis, tangent to the
bottom and the end of a .
